alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 7:09PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 708 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding has already happened or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Fivemile Wash, Leroux Wash, Washboard Wash, East Washboard Wash, Porter Tank Draw, Little Colorado River and McDonald Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Navajo County - This includes the following highways... State Route 377 between mile markers 23 and 33. State Route 77 near mile marker 381. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
